group.title: Communicate
group.instructions: These instrcutions flow down to sub-groups / pages
group.text: this text should not flow down and only be visible when this level of grouping is desired

group.title: Communicate How
group.instructions: The policy may specify the method (e.g., mail, email, Internet, phone, etc.) by which passwords may or may not be communicated or shared.

group.title: Specific Methods
group.instructions: Use the following questions to indicate any policy statements made about using specific methods (such as mail, email, voicemail, networks, etc.) to communicate or share passwords.

group.title: Password Composition
group.instructions: The policy may state what characters, words, or pre-existing passwords may or may not be used when creating new passwords.

page.title: Instructions for Character Selection
page.instructions:
The policy’s statements about the selection of individual characters are addressed in the next three subsections:
– Character occurrence asks about the use of alphanumeric and special characters;
– Character positionasks about what characters may or may not be used at various locations within a password; and
– Character combination asks about specific combinations, sequences and patterns of characters.

group.title: Character Occurrence
group.instructions: Check all of the character types (e.g., upper case, numbers, etc.) mentioned in the policy regarding password creation, and answer the relevant questions for each type. The questions will ask whether those characters are prohibited or recommended against, and if not, whether the policy sets minimums or maximums for the number of times those characters can be present in a password.

group.title: Character Position
group.instructions: Policies might identify character types that may or may not be used at various positions in a password, including the first character, last character, internal characters, and first several characters. You will be asked to identify all of the conditions stated by the policy.

question.text: Does the policy identify people with whom users may not communicate or share passwords?

option.text: Yes
Maybe
No

question.text: The policy states the following about not communicating or sharing passwords(select one):

option.text: The policy prohibits communicating or sharing passwords with anyone.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not communicate passwords to anyone.

option.text: The policy prohibits communicating or sharing passwords with a third party.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not communicate passwords to a third party.

option.text: The policy recommends against communicating or sharing passwords with anyone.
option.BNF_mapping: Users should not communicate passwords to anyone.

option.text: The policy recommends against communicating or sharing passwords with a third party.
option.BNF_mapping: Users should not communicate passwords to a third party.

question.title: Communicate How
question.text: The policy may specify the method (e.g., mail, email, Internet, phone, etc.) by which passwords may or may not be communicated or shared.

question.title: Any Method
question.text: Does the policy make a general statement about communicating or sharing passwords “by any method” (or using similar words)?

option.text: Yes - the policy prohibits communicating or sharing passwords by any method.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not communicate passwords by any means

option.text: Yes - the policy recommends against communicating or sharing passwords by any method.
option.BNF_mapping: Users should not communicate passwords by any means

option.text: No - the policy does not make a general statement about communicating or sharing passwords “by any method.”

question.title: Communicate by specific methods
question.text: Use the following questions to indicate any policy statements made about using specific methods (such as mail, email, voicemail, networks, etc.) to communicate or share passwords.

question.title: Communication using any network
question.text: Does the policy prohibit or recommend against communicating or sharing passwords on any network?

option.text: Yes - the policy prohibits communicating or sharing passwords on any network.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not communicate passwords by any network

option.text: Yes - the policy prohibits communicating or sharing unencrypted passwords on any network.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not communicate passwords by any network without encryption

option.text: Yes - the policy recommends against communicating or sharing passwords on any network.
option.BNF_mapping: Users should not communicate passwords by any network

option.text: Yes - the policy recommends against communicating or sharing unencrypted passwords on any network.
option.BNF_mapping: Users should not communicate passwords by any network without encryption

option.text: No - the policy does not make a statement about using any network. to communicate or share passwords.

question.title: Communication using the Internet or a Wide Area Network (WAN)
question.text: Does the policy prohibit or recommend against communicating or sharing passwords using the Internet or a Wide Area Network (WAN)?

option.text: Yes - the policy prohibits communicating or sharing passwords using the Internet or a Wide Area Network (WAN).
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not communicate passwords by internet or wide area network.

option.text: Yes - the policy recommends against communicating or sharing passwords using the Internet or a Wide Area Network (WAN).
option.BNF_mapping: Users should not communicate passwords by internet or wide area network.

option.text: Yes - the policy prohibits communicating or sharing unencrypted passwords using the Internet or a Wide Area Network (WAN).
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not communicate passwords by internet or wide area network without encryption.

option.text: Yes - the policy recommends against communicating or sharing unencrypted passwords using the Internet or a Wide Area Network (WAN).
option.BNF_mapping: Users should not communicate passwords by internet or wide area network without encryption.

option.text: No - the policy does not make a statement about using the Internet or a WAN to communicate or share passwords.

question.title: Emergency Situations
question.text: Identify any exceptions that the policy makes for communicating or sharing passwords in emergency situations:

option.text: The policy prohibits communicating or sharing passwords, except in emergency situations.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not communicate passwords except in an emergency.

option.text: The policy recommends against communicating or sharing passwords, except in emergency situations.
option.BNF_mapping: Users should not communicate passwords except in an emergency.

option.text: The policy does not make a statement about communicating or sharing passwords, in emergency situations.

question.title: Minimum Password Length
question.text: This Policy:

option.text: {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.1.A.a" , "type":"select one" , "options":["requires" , "recommends"] , "default":"select one"}} that passwords have at least {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.1.A.b" , "type":"numerical" , "validation":{"min":"1" , "max":"30", "title": "please enter a number betweeen 1 and 30"}}} characters.
option.BNF_mapping: Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.1.A.a" , "option_text":"requires" , "bnf_text":"must"}} create passwords with length greater than or equal to {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.1.A.b"}} characters.
Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.1.A.a" , "option_text":"recommends" , "bnf_text":"should"}} create passwords with length greater than or equal to {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.1.A.b"}} characters.

option.text: {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.1.B.a" , "type":"select one" , "options":["requires" , "recommends"]}} that passwords have a minimum length, but does not specify a particular number.
makes no statement about minimum password length

question.title: Maximum Password Length
question.text: This Policy:

option.text: {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.2.A.a" , "type":"select one" , "options":["requires" , "recommends"] , "default":"select one"}} that passwords have no more than {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.2.A.b" , "type":"numerical" , "validation":{"min":"2", "max":"100"}}} characters.
option.BNF_mapping: Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.2.A.a" , "option_text":"requires" , "bnf_text":"must"}} create passwords with length greater than or equal to {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.2.A.b"}} characters.
Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.2.A.a" , "option_text":"recommends" , "bnf_text":"should"}} create passwords with length greater than or equal to {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.2.A.b"}} characters.

option.text: {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.2.B.a", "type":"select one" , "options":["requires", "recommends"]}} that passwords have a maximum length, but does not specify a particular number.
makes no statement about minimum password length

response.text: Upper case letters are mentioned in the policy.

question.text: Does the policy prohibit (or recommend against) using upper case letters?

option.text: Yes - they are prohibited.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not create passwords with a character in the set of upper-case letters.

option.text: Yes - they are not recommended.
option.BNF_mapping: Users should not create passwords with a character in the set of upper-case letters.

option.text: No – upper case letters are allowed.

question.text: Is at least one (1) upper case letter needed?

option.text: Yes
No

response.text: The policy {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.3.1.2.1.a" , "type":"select one" , "options":["requires" , "recommends"]}} that at least {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.3.1.2.1.b" , "type":"numerical" , "validation":{"min":"1" , "max":"9", "title":"Please check your answer"}}} characters in the password are upper case letters.

question.BNF_mapping: Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.3.1.2.1.a" , "option_text":"requires" , "bnf_text":"must"}} create passwords with {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.3.1.2.1.b"}} or more characters in the set of upper-case letters.

Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.3.1.2.1.a" , "option_text":"recommends" , "bnf_text":"should"}} create passwords with {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.3.1.2.1.b"}} or more characters in the set of upper-case letters.

question.text: Is there a limit to how many upper case letters can be used in a password?

option.text: Yes
No

response.text: The policy {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.3.1.3.1.a" , "type":"select one" , "options":["requires" , "recommends"]}} that no more than {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.3.1.3.1.b", "type":"numerical" , "validation":{"min":"1", "max":"9", "title":"please check your answer"}}} characters in the password are upper case letters.

question.BNF_mapping: Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.3.1.3.1.a", "option_text":"requires" , "bnf_text":"must"}} not create passwords with {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.3.1.3.1.b"}} or more characters in the set of upper-case letters.

Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.3.1.3.1.a", "option_text":"recommends" , "bnf_text":"should"}} not create passwords with {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.3.1.3.1.b"}} or more characters in the set of upper-case letters.

response.text: Lower case letters are mentioned in the policy.

question.text: Does the policy prohibit (or recommend against) using lower case letters?

option.text: Yes - they are prohibited.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not create passwords with a character in the set of lower-case letters.

option.text: Yes - they are not recommended.
option.BNF_mapping: Users should not create passwords with a character in the set of lower-case letters.

option.text: No – lower case letters are allowed.

question.text: Is at least one (1) lower case letter needed?

option.text: Yes
No

response.text: The policy {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.3.2.2.1.a" , "type":"select one" , "options":["requires" , "recommends"]}} that at least {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.3.2.2.1.b" , "type":"numerical" , "validation":{"min":"1" , "max":"9"}}} characters in the password are lower case letters.

Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.3.2.2.1.a" , "option_text":"recommends" , "bnf_text":"should"}} create passwords with {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.3.2.2.1.b"}} or more characters in the set of lower-case letters.

question.text: Is there a limit to how many lower case letters can be used in a password?

option.text: Yes
No

response.text: The policy {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.3.2.3.1.a" , "type":"select one" , "options":["requires" , "recommends"]}} that no more than {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.3.2.3.1.b" , "type":"numerical" , "validation":{"min":"1" , "max":"9"}}} characters in the password are lower case letters.

question.BNF_mapping: Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.3.2.3.1.a" , "option_text":"requires" , "bnf_text":"must"}} not create passwords with {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.3.2.3.1.b"}} or more characters in the set of lower-case letters.

Users {"ident":{"cref":"q.2.3.2.3.1.a" , "option_text":"recommends" , "bnf_text":"should"}} not create passwords with {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.3.2.3.1.b"}} or more characters in the set of lower-case letters.

question.text: The policy identifies the following characters and requires that one (1) or more be used in passwords:

response.text: {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.3.7.1.a" , "type":"textbox" , "validation":{"pattern":"[^ ]*", "title":"Please do not include spaces between characters"}}}

No

question.title: First Character
question.text: Does the policy state whether the first character of a password can or cannot be a specific type of character (e.g., upper case letter, number, special character, etc.)?

option.text: Yes
No

response.text: For the first character of a password, {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.7.1.1.a" , "type":"select multi" , "options":["upper case letters" , "lower case letters" , "letters (unspecified case)" , "numbers" , "special characters (unspecified)" , "punctuation" , "control characters or non-printable characters" , "whitespace" , "all other characters (unspecified)"]}} are {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.7.1.1.b" , "type":"select one" , "options":["prohibited" , "not recommended" , "recommended" , "required"]}}

question.text: Does the policy make another statement about character types in the password’s first character position?

option.text: Yes
No

question.title: Passwords with all characters from specific character sets
question.text: Does the policy state whether all of a password’s characters must come from specific character sets (e.g., “Password characters must consist of only letters and numbers.”)?

option.text: Yes – the policy requires that all password characters come from the character sets identified below (check all that apply).
option.BNF_mapping: Users must create passwords with all characters in the set of {"insert":{"qref":"q.2.20.1" , "separator":", ", "mod":{"option_ref":"2.20.1.J", "bnf_text":"these special characters:"}}} {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.20.1.J.a", "mod":{"option_ref":"2.20.1.E", "bnf_text":"special characters (unspec)"}}}.

option.text: Yes – the policy recommends that all password characters come from the character sets identified below (check all that apply).
option.BNF_mapping: Users should create passwords with all characters in the set of {"insert":{"qref":"q.2.20.1" , "separator":", ", "mod":{"option_ref":"1.20.1.J" , "bnf_text":"these special characters:"}}} {"insert":{"cref":"q.2.20.1.J.a", "mod":{"option_ref":"2.20.2.E", "bnf_text":"special characters (unspec)"}}}.

option.text: No.
upper case letters
lower case letters
letters (unspecified case)
numbers
"special characters" (unspecified)
punctuation
control characters or non-printable characters
whitespace
all other (unspecified) characters
a list of individually-identified special characters (please list them): {"cloze":{"id":"q.2.20.1.J.a", "type":"textbox", "validation":{"pattern":"[^ ]*"}}}

question.title: Incorrect password entry
question.text: Does the policy indicate the number of incorrect passwords that will trigger a user lockout?

option.text: Yes. The policy states that users will be locked out when:
No the policy does not address user lockout at all.
No the policy states that a user can be locked out, but it does not indicate the number of incorrect passwords that will trigger a lockout.

question.text: The policy states that users will be locked out when:

option.text: They enter { "cloze":{"id":"q.3.13.1.A.a" , "type":"numerical" , "validation":{"min":"1" , "max":"500" }}} incorrect passwords.

They enter { "cloze":{"id":"q.3.13.1.B.a" , "type":"numerical" , "validation":{"min":"1" , "max":"500" }}} incorrect passwords in { "cloze":{"id":"q.3.13.1.B.b" , "type":"numerical" , "validation":{"min":"1" , "max":"59"} , "default":"Amount of Time" }} {"cloze": {"id":"q.3.13.1.B.c" , "type":"select one" , "options":["second(s)" , "minute(s)" , "hour(s)"] , "default":"select one" }}.

question.title: Lockout Duration and Recovery.
question.text: For the type of authentication failure selected in the previous question, identify the associated lockout duration and/or recovery method.
When a user enters {"insert": {"cref":"q.3.13.1.A.a"}} incorrect passwords:

option.text: the lockout lasts for an unspecified period of time.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not fail to authenticate {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.A.a"}} times to avoid a lockout of unspecified duration

option.text: the lockout lasts for {"cloze":{"id":"q.3.14.1.B.a", "type":"numerical", "validation":{"min":"1" , "max":"500"}}} {"cloze":{"id":"q.3.14.1.B.b", "type":"select one", "options":["second(s)" , "minute(s)" , "hour(s)"] , "validation":"required" }}
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not fail to authenticate {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.A.a"}} times to avoid a {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.14.1.B.a"}} {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.14.1.B.b" , "mod":{"option_text":"second(s)" , "bnf_text":"second"} , "mod":{"option_text":"minute(s)" , "bnf_text":"minute"} , "mod":{"option_text":"hour(s)" , "bnf_text":"hour"}}} lockout.

option.text: an administrator must unlock the account.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not fail to authenticate {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.A.a"}} times to avoid administrative unlock.

question.text: When a user enters {"insert":{ "cref":"3.13.1.B.a"}} incorrect passwords in {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.b"}} {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.c"}}:

option.text: the lockout lasts for an unspecified period of time.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not fail to authenticate {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.a"}} times in a {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.b"}} {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.c" , "mod":{"option_text":"second(s)" , "bnf_text":"second"} , "mod":{"option_text":"minute(s)" , "bnf_text":"minute"} , "mod":{"option_text":"hour(s)" , "bnf_text":"hour"}}} interval to avoid a lockout of unspecified duration.

option.text: the lockout lasts for {"cloze":{"id":"q.3.14.2.B.a" , "type":"numerical", "validation": {"min":"1" , "max":"500"}}} {"cloze":{"id":"q.3.14.2.B.b" , "type":"select one" , "options":["second(s)" , "minute(s)" , "hour(s)"] , "validation":"required" }}
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not fail to authenticate {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.a"}} times in a {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.b"}} {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.c" , "mod":{"option_text":"second(s)" , "bnf_text":"second"} , "mod":{"option_text":"minute(s)" , "bnf_text":"minute"} , "mod":{"option_text":"hour(s)" , "bnf_text":"hour"}}} interval to avoid a {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.14.2.B.a"}} {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.14.2.B.b" , "mod":{"option_text":"second(s)" , "bnf_text":"second"} , "mod":{"option_text":"minute(s)" , "bnf_text":"minute"} , "mod":{"option_text":"hour(s)" , "bnf_text":"hour"}}} lockout.

option.text: an administrator must unlock the account.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not fail to authenticate {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.a"}} times in a {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.b"}} {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.c"}} interval to avoid administrative unlock.

option.text: either an administrator must unlock the account OR the lockout lasts for {"cloze":{"id":"q.3.14.2.D.a" , "type":"numerical" , "validation":{"min":"1" , "max":"500"}}} {"cloze":{"id":"q.3.14.2.D.b" , "type":"select one" , "options":["second(s)" , "minute(s)" , "hour(s)"] , "validation":"required" }}.
option.BNF_mapping: Users must not fail to authenticate {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.a"}} times in a {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.b"}} {"insert":{"cref":"q.3.13.1.B.c" , "mod":{"option_text":"second(s)" , "bnf_text":"second"} , "mod":{"option_text":"minute(s)" , "bnf_text":"minute"} , "mod":{"option_text":"hour(s)" , "bnf_text":"hour"}}} interval to avoid administrative unlock or a {"insert":{ "cref":"3.14.2.D.a"}} {"insert":{ "cref":"3.14.2.D.b"}} lockout.

sign_up.pgtitle: Sign up for the Password Policy Formalization Study
sign_up.name_taken: This name is reserved for internal usage - please choose a different name.
sign_up.intro_text: Lorem Ipsum blah Lorem Ipsum blah Lorem Ipsum blah Lorem Ipsum blah Lorem Ipsum blah Lorem Ipsum blah Lorem Ipsum blah Lorem Ipsum blah
sign_up.instructions:
Please enter a user name.
It must consist of only letters and numbers. If you forget this user name, your account cannot be recovered. Only a scrambled version of this name is ever stored in order to protect your identity.

policies_for_review.instructions: Select a policy - you will be taken to the policy questionnaire, and a pdf of the policy will open in a separate window. Your responses are automatically saved at all times.

questionnaire.back_text: Back to Policies For Review (all progress saved)
